    • Method Detail

      • getImageConvolved

        public ImageCore getImageConvolved(ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy normalizationPolicy)
        Description copied from interface: ConvolutionBase
        Allows to apply the mask on the image data and to normalize the results according to some policy. The policy can aim at accuracy of the results, maximizing contrast, or preservation of the values of an integer mask as is (without dividing by the weight of the mask).
        Specified by:
        getImageConvolved in interface ConvolutionBase
        Parameters:
        normalizationPolicy - The policy for normalizing the results.
        Returns:
        The resulting image with the convolution applied, as well as a normalization policy.
        See Also:
        ConvolutionBase.getImageConvolved(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.convolve.ConvolutionNormalizationPolicy)

      • normalizeOutputValues

        public ConvolutionBaseGeneric normalizeOutputValues()
        Normalizes the image for quantitative accuracy by dividing by the masks accumulated weights. In other words, the values are divided by the m_normalizationDenominator value. This denominator is then set to 1.
        Returns:
        The reference to this instance to allow for use of the cascade pattern.

      • applyMask

        public abstract ConvolutionBaseGeneric applyMask()
        Description copied from interface: ConvolutionBase
        Allows to Convolve the mask of this instance with the image underlying this instance. This is done by embedding the image (if necessary) and storing it in an attribute, which can then be retrieved after normalization. Note that this operation might become protected (and therefore removed from this interface) in the future because its use might be obscure and lead to errors.
        Specified by:
        applyMask in interface ConvolutionBase
        Returns:
        The reference to this instance to allow for use of the cascade pattern.
        See Also:
        ConvolutionBase.applyMask()

      • partialFiniteDifference

        public ConvolutionBaseGeneric partialFiniteDifference(CoordinateAxis axis,
                                                      int order,
                                                      int skippingStep)
        Allows to apply a finite difference to compute a partial differential along the Z axis. A centered symmetric difference is computed between point distant from 2*skippingStepZ. This process is iterated orderZ times. No normalization is performed, and therefore dividing by (2*skippingStepZ)^orderZ should be taken care of later if required.
        Parameters:
        axis - The coordinate axis along which to evaluate a partial derivative
        order - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; second coordinate
        skippingStep - The skipping step used for finite difference evaluation
        Returns:
        The Convolution Kernel implementing the applyMask() method allowing to apply a finite difference.

      • partialFiniteDifferenceCalibrated

        public ConvolutionBaseGeneric partialFiniteDifferenceCalibrated(ImageCalibration imageCalibration,
                                                                CoordinateAxis axis,
                                                                int order,
                                                                double realSkippingStep)
        Allows to apply a finite difference to compute a partial differential along the Z axis. A centered symmetric difference is computed between point distant from 2*skippingStepZ. This process is iterated orderZ times. No normalization is performed, and therefore dividing by (2*skippingStepZ)^orderZ should be taken care of later if required.
        Parameters:
        imageCalibration - Image Calibration metadata (see ImageCore.getImageCalibration()).
        axis - The coordinate axis along which to evaluate a partial derivative
        order - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; second coordinate
        realSkippingStep - The skipping step used for finite difference evaluation, considered as a multiple of the calibration's voxel edge's length.
        Returns:
        The Convolution Kernel implementing the applyMask() method allowing to apply a finite difference.

      • finiteDifference

        public ConvolutionBase finiteDifference(int orderX,
                                        int orderY,
                                        int orderZ,
                                        int skippingStepX,
                                        int skippingStepY,
                                        int skippingStepZ)
        Computes a Partial Differential of arbitrary order in each direction by (iterated) finite differences with skipping steps. A centered symmetric difference is computed between point distant from 2*skippingStep. This process is iterated order times for each direction. The results can be normalized according to different policies.
        Parameters:
        orderX - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; first coordinate
        orderY - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; second coordinate
        orderZ - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; second coordinate
        skippingStepX - Skipping step in X
        skippingStepY - Skipping step in Y
        skippingStepZ - Skipping step in Z
        Returns:
        The Convolution Kernel implementing the applyMask() method allowing to apply a finite difference.

      • finiteDifferenceCalibrated

        public ConvolutionBase finiteDifferenceCalibrated(ImageCalibration imageCalibration,
                                                  int orderX,
                                                  int orderY,
                                                  int orderZ,
                                                  double realSkippingStepX,
                                                  double realSkippingStepY,
                                                  double realSkippingStepZ)
        Computes a Partial Differential of the image by (iterated) finite differences with skipping steps. A centered symmetric difference is computed between point distant from 2*skippingStep. This process is iterated order times for each direction. The results can be normalized according to different policies. The metadata associated to this image is copied to the metadata of the resulting image. This method does the same as finiteDifference(int, int, int, int, int, int) except the skipping steps are given in (approximately) multiples of the calibration data (Voxels edges lengths in a given length unit) instead of number of voxels.
        Parameters:
        imageCalibration - Image Calibration metadata (see ImageCore.getImageCalibration()).
        orderX - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; first coordinate
        orderY - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; second coordinate
        orderZ - cardinality of the support of the smoothing mask; second coordinate
        realSkippingStepX - Skipping step in X
        realSkippingStepY - Skipping step in Y
        realSkippingStepZ - Skipping step in Z
        Returns:
        The Convolution Kernel implementing the applyMask() method allowing to apply a finite difference.

      • getGradientNorm

        public ImageCore getGradientNorm(int skippingStepX,
                                 int skippingStepY,
                                 int skippingStepZ,
                                 int scaleDenominatorIntermediateValues)
        Computes an image with unsigned values representing the gradient norm of the current result image. The current output image (from a previous calculation) is copied to the input image, performing a scale if necessary for bit depth compatibility.
        Parameters:
        skippingStepX - Skipping step in X
        skippingStepY - Skipping step in Y
        skippingStepZ - Skipping step in Z
        scaleDenominatorIntermediateValues - A value by which to divide the squared partial differentials to ensure the result fits into the bit depth of outputLinearCombination.
        Returns:
        The norm of the gradient of the image as an unsigned image.

      • getGradientNorm

        public ImageCore getGradientNorm(int skippingStepX,
                                 int skippingStepY,
                                 int skippingStepZ,
                                 ImageCore outputImageBuffer,
                                 int scaleDenominatorIntermediateValues)
        Computes an image with unsigned values representing the gradient norm of the input image.
        Parameters:
        skippingStepX - Skipping step in X
        skippingStepY - Skipping step in Y
        skippingStepZ - Skipping step in Z
        outputImageBuffer - An image to store the result, which should be able to store the gray levels without overflow.
        scaleDenominatorIntermediateValues - A value by which to divide the squared partial differentials to ensure the result fits into the bit depth of outputLinearCombination.
        Returns:
        The norm of the gradient of the image as an unsigned image.

      • getGradientNormCalibrated

        public ImageCore getGradientNormCalibrated(double realSkippingStepX,
                                           double realSkippingStepY,
                                           double realSkippingStepZ,
                                           int scaleDenominatorIntermediateValues)
        Computes an image with unsigned values representing the gradient norm of the current result image. The current output image (from a previous calculation) is copied to the input image, performing a scale if necessary for bit depth compatibility.
        Parameters:
        realSkippingStepX - Skipping step in X
        realSkippingStepY - Skipping step in Y
        realSkippingStepZ - Skipping step in Z
        scaleDenominatorIntermediateValues - A value by which to divide the squared partial differentials to ensure the result fits into the bit depth of outputLinearCombination.
        Returns:
        The norm of the gradient of the image as an unsigned image.
